physDesc.p: This letter is two pages long. “H.M. Page 2” is typed in the top left corner of the second page.

div.p: 1912 carefully stated to be convenient official date for beginning of New Poetry because leading exponents began to publish at or about that time. Spoon River (Edgar Lee Masters) 1914, Frost’s book England, 1913. Pound from 1909 England.Fletcher books London 1913. Lawrence Anthology Georgian poetry 1912, first book London 1913. Untermeyer book 1913. My first book October 1912, same date as Poetry. Only poets directly introduced by Poetry in this list Lindsay, Aldington, H.D. and Sandburg. Your reference to Crane and Dickinson therefore not pertinent. Never denied the existence of special poets prior to 1912, but movement can be rightly considered to have become a distinct concerted move in 1912. Your starting Poetry another manifestation of this urge. Date 1912 refers to when publication started, not to individual experiment. Reference to Pound’s experiments therefore not in order, for we were all experimenting. First poem in my 1912 volume in vers libre. Your definition of new movement as defined separation from Victorian tradition excellent, but account of derivation faulty. Three main current in English literature early Nineteenth century: Romantic,Byron; ethical,Wordsworth; modern, Coleridge. English literature practically divided between followers of Wordsworth and Byron.Wordsworth’s influence most marked in America of 19th Century, particularly in poets of New England group. Poe is Coleridge’s most important follow.Coleridge and Poe greatly influenced French literature. From them French symbolism sprang. Whitman almost without prototype. Might be considered admixture of Coleridge and Wordsworth influences. American poetry of new style divides into two streams, those sprung from Whitman and those sprung from French symbolistes. Imagists derive from latter. Please make this last point clear. Your paragraph does not make this quite clear. Article most interesting. Many Thanks.
